title: 2019–20 Australian bushfire season
summary: The 2019–20 Australian bushfire season,[lower-alpha 1] colloquially known as the Black Summer,[13][16] was a period of unusually intense bushfires in many parts of Australia.  Nationally, Australian National University described the 2019 fire year as "close to average"[17] and the 2020 fire year as "unusually small".[18] However, the apparently "close to average" fire year 2019 was explained by the observation that, "Fire activity was low in northern Australia but unprecedented in southeast Australia."[17]
